title: Frequently Asked Questions
subtitle: Everything you wonder about IVF treatment

faq-1.question: What is the IVF treatment process like?
faq-1.answer: IVF treatment is a medical procedure applied to individuals who cannot have children naturally.The reason for undergoing IVF may vary from person to person, and there are different treatment methods tailored to each individual.

faq-2.question: In which cases should IVF treatment be considered?
faq-2.answer:
For newly married young couples: Unprotected intercourse is recommended for 1 year. If pregnancy does not occur after that, a medical consultation is advised.For women over 35: Unprotected intercourse for 6 months is recommended. If no pregnancy occurs, evaluation is advised.For women over 40: An early medical consultation is recommended.Additionally:
  • Couples who have had 2–3 miscarriages and still cannot conceive,
  • Couples with hereditary chromosomal disorders,
  • Men with sperm disorders,
  • Women with uterine problems,
  • Women who have entered menopause or have never menstruated at a young age,
  • Women diagnosed with low AMH, polycystic ovary, or endometriosis should definitely undergo a medical check-up.

faq-3.question: Are donor eggs or sperm used in IVF treatment?
faq-3.answer: Donor eggs and/or sperm are used only in treatments where the patient specifically requires a donor.Your own eggs and sperm are never used for anyone else, and there is no risk of them being mixed with another person’s samples.No procedure is performed without your consent during IVF treatment.

faq-4.question: What is the age limit to have a baby using my own eggs?
faq-4.answer: It is not possible to give an exact answer to this. It varies by person and should be determined through tests and ultrasound evaluations.Generally, to achieve healthy results with your own eggs, you should not be menopausal or beyond a certain age. Usually under 35 is considered ideal, but this may vary. As age progresses, egg count, quality, and energy decrease, and genetic issues become more frequent.If you are around 35, not married yet, or do not plan to have a child soon, you may consider freezing your eggs for the future.

faq-5.question: What is the egg freezing procedure and when is it recommended?
faq-5.answer: Egg freezing involves stimulating a woman’s ovaries through hormone injections to mature the egg follicles.After about 12 days of treatment, the follicles are collected under mild anesthesia, and high-quality eggs are frozen and stored.Later, these can be fertilized with the partner’s sperm to form embryos, and healthy embryos can be transferred to achieve pregnancy.This procedure is recommended for women who are not planning to have children soon, those undergoing cancer treatments like chemotherapy, or those who may need to have their ovaries removed for medical reasons.

faq-6.question: Is it necessary to be married for IVF treatment?
faq-6.answer: In Northern Cyprus, marriage is not a legal requirement for IVF treatment.

faq-7.question: Up to what age can I undergo IVF treatment?
faq-7.answer: In Northern Cyprus, the age limit for IVF is more flexible, but certain regulations apply.In general:Up to age 44, treatment is allowed if there are no health problems preventing pregnancy. For women aged 45–54, medical reports and Ministry of Health approval are required. For those over 55, financial and medical documentation must also be submitted.

faq-8.question: Is it possible to get pregnant after menopause?
faq-8.answer: If a woman in menopause has no endometrial or major health problems, she can become pregnant through egg donation treatment.

faq-9.question: Do you guarantee success in IVF treatment?
faq-9.answer: It is impossible to guarantee success in IVF treatment.The success rate depends on the woman’s age, uterine condition, sperm quality, and the quality of the embryos. For this reason, no clinic can guarantee 100% success.

faq-10.question: How can I increase my IVF success rate?
faq-10.answer: There are many ways to improve IVF success rates. Maintaining a healthy lifestyle — balanced diet, exercise, hydration, limited caffeine, and avoiding smoking — greatly improves egg and sperm quality.Additionally, medical techniques such as Embryoscope, Microchip, and PGD can further boost success rates.For more detailed information, visit the BLOG section on our homepage to watch videos and read articles.
